answers.answer: Hello,Common causes causing erection problem are stress and anxiety, poor communication with your partner, unrealistic sexual expectations, which make sex a task rather than a pleasure,negative feelings about non performance, smoking, alcohol and sometimes illicit drugs and medical conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, heart or thyroid conditions, poor circulation, low testosterone, depression, spinal cord injury, nerve damage (for example, from prostate surgery), or neurologic disorders (such as multiple sclerosis or Parkinson's disease).Please get yourself evaluated for the medical conditions mentioned above. Hope it helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing. Kind regards.

question: Hi I'm a 16 year old healthy, active teen and I'm experiencing erectile dysfunction. I know most people would say if it happens when I'm a teen its mostly anxiety, but I can't seem to get a full erection at any time, rather then just with my girlfriend... I am verrry attracted to her and I get that sexual arroused feeling when I'm with her but it seems that my penis won't fill up with blood. I don't think I obsess about it but maybe in the back of my mind I do and that is all I need for the anxiety to stop it... I just want to know the possibilities. I even stopped smoking cigarettes. It seems to get better by the days but I just want to know forsure that it will get better and the possible problems.  Thanks
title: Cannot get an full erection anymore...
